flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

lines.text: Lay the spacer tube on top of the press plate, align the sides and make the back edge flush.
lines.text_raw: Lay the spacer tube on top of the press plate, align the sides and make the back edge flush.

lines.text: Insure all edges are tight and squared; this piece is critical, it must be a uniform height throughout the entire item. Grind off any imperfections.
lines.text_raw: Insure all edges are tight and squared; this piece is critical, it must be a uniform height throughout the entire item. Grind off any imperfections.

lines.text: Tack weld the two together in many places (at least 3 on each seam).
lines.text_raw: Tack weld the two together in many places (at least 3 on each seam).

lines.text: Double check everything for squareness!!
lines.text_raw: Double check everything for squareness!!

lines.text: Weld the two together on all edges where they touch
lines.text_raw: Weld the two together on all edges where they touch

lines.text: It is a good idea to weld in 1” or 2” increments, skipping around to different places to prevent warpage. You will need to weld multiple layers where the tubing is rounded.
lines.text_raw: It is a good idea to weld in 1” or 2” increments, skipping around to different places to prevent warpage. You will need to weld multiple layers where the tubing is rounded.

lines.text: Place the vertical support and tack it in multiple places
lines.text_raw: Place the vertical support and tack it in multiple places

lines.text: Weld the vertical support to the press plate and spacer tube assembly.
lines.text_raw: Weld the vertical support to the press plate and spacer tube assembly.

lines.text: Grind down the welds on the open end of the tube so they are flush with the rest of the tube
lines.text_raw: Grind down the welds on the open end of the tube so they are flush with the rest of the tube

lines.text: Lay the spacer/press plate assembly down so the press plate is touching the table.
lines.text_raw: Lay the spacer/press plate assembly down so the press plate is touching the table.

lines.text: Align side pieces with spacer and press plate assembly.
lines.text_raw: Align side pieces with spacer and press plate assembly.

lines.text: Insure the two are square vertically and horizontally with the spacer, that they are parallel, and that everything is touching the table.
lines.text_raw: Insure the two are square vertically and horizontally with the spacer, that they are parallel, and that everything is touching the table.

lines.text: It helps to use angle iron tacked to your table and the sides, so it insures they are vertically square. This also makes it a bit easier to align everything else. Video Help
lines.text_raw: It helps to use angle iron tacked to your table and the sides, so it insures they are vertically square. This also makes it a bit easier to align everything else. [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HnFXzrwzsjg&list=UUjvBN1r7UXXqmIbx_u7bIAw&index=339&feature=plpp_video|Video Help]

lines.text: Also, it may help to use paper shims (see between the sides and the tube to properly space them. Video Help
lines.text_raw: Also, it may help to use paper shims (see between the sides and the tube to properly space them. [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bahhYtxy4Zg&list=UUjvBN1r7UXXqmIbx_u7bIAw&index=203&feature=plpp_video|Video Help]

lines.text: Tack the sides to the tube on all sides in multiple places except where it is touching the table. Add a few 1" seams to prohibit them from moving.
lines.text_raw: Tack the sides to the tube on all sides in multiple places except where it is touching the table. Add a few 1" seams to prohibit them from moving.

lines.text: Do a few light tacks first, and double check it's still square. If not, grind off the tacks and start over.
lines.text_raw: Do a few light tacks first, and double check it's still square. If not, grind off the tacks and start over.

lines.text: Tack the back piece in a few spots, with a 1" seam on each side.
lines.text_raw: Tack the back piece in a few spots, with a 1" seam on each side.

lines.text: Grind off the welds for the back and side pieces so that the entire drawer is flush.
lines.text_raw: Grind off the welds for the back and side pieces so that the entire drawer is flush.

lines.text: Flip the drawer over and tack the sides from the top.
lines.text_raw: Flip the drawer over and tack the sides from the top.

lines.text: Place the roof and inner rails in their respective places. See Diagram.
lines.text_raw: Place the roof and inner rails in their respective places. See Diagram.

lines.text: Insure inner rails are perfectly parallel (varying no more than a 16th of an inch) and square throughout the entire length.
lines.text_raw: Insure inner rails are perfectly parallel (varying no more than a 16th of an inch) and square throughout the entire length.

lines.text: Tack them in multiple places except where they are touching the table.
lines.text_raw: Tack them in multiple places except where they are touching the table.

lines.text: Insure they are perfectly parallel; otherwise they will leave the roller guides. Insure they vary no more than 1/16" over the entire length.
lines.text_raw: Insure they are perfectly parallel; otherwise they will leave the roller guides. Insure they vary no more than 1/16" over the entire length.

lines.text: Hint: Use paper shims for this
lines.text_raw: Hint: Use paper shims for this

lines.text: All the seams should be completely welded except the difficult to reach places between the inner and outer rails, those can be welded about 50%.
lines.text_raw: All the seams should be completely welded except the difficult to reach places between the inner and outer rails, those can be welded about 50%.

lines.text: Weld short lengths at a time and jump around a lot to minimize warping.
lines.text_raw: Weld short lengths at a time and jump around a lot to minimize warping.

lines.text: You may want to grind off the welds in between passes around the drawer to allow it to cool.
lines.text_raw: You may want to grind off the welds in between passes around the drawer to allow it to cool.

lines.text: There cannot be any outstanding bumps or welds anywhere; the drawer will be sliding in and out of a tight spot and bumps will catch on the frame crossmembers.
lines.text_raw: There cannot be any outstanding bumps or welds anywhere; the drawer will be sliding in and out of a tight spot and bumps will catch on the frame crossmembers.

lines.text: Make sure there's no welding spatter where the rollers will be rolling. Grind any off with a small grinder
lines.text_raw: Make sure there's no welding spatter where the rollers will be rolling. Grind any off with a small grinder

lines.text: The rails likely got warped outwards on the side with the back while you were welding.
lines.text_raw: The rails likely got warped outwards on the side with the back while you were welding.

lines.text: If they are not still parallel, you will need to pinch them inwards so that they are. You can do so using two C-Clamps.
lines.text_raw: If they are not still parallel, you will need to pinch them inwards so that they are. You can do so using two C-Clamps.

lines.text: Prepare as shown in the diagram
lines.text_raw: Prepare as shown in the diagram

lines.text: Weld it to the back of the drawer, insuring it is square and centered
lines.text_raw: Weld it to the back of the drawer, insuring it is square and centered
